p: In this survey, in acute care hospitals the 10 most commonly isolated organisms included E. coli (16.1%), S. aureus (11.6%), Klebsiella spp. (10.4%), Enterococcus spp. (9.7%), P. aeruginosa (8.0%), C. difficile (7.3%), Coagulase negative Staphylococci (7.1%), Candida spp. (5.2%), Enterobacter spp. (4.4%), and Proteus spp. (3.8%).
